intro: Phacelia hastata var. leptosepala, commonly known as the slender-sepaled phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a grayish-green color due to the dense covering of fine hairs. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
